rdf:Description.rdfs:label: attribute
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Point to a concept representing the attribute.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: system type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The type of system. Values are from some controlled vocabulary.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The TERN Ontology comprises a set of vocabularies for representing plot-based ecological data. It was developed primarily based on the SOSA (Sensor, Observation, Sample, and Actuator) ontology. The TERN Ontology's classes and properties have been tailored to describe terrestrial ecology survey data including flora, vegetation and soil, following the methodologies outlined in the Australian Soil and Land Survey Field Handbook.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TERN Ontology
Feature of Interest
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling.
rdf:Description.skos:example: When measuring the height of a tree, the height is the observed ObservableProperty, 20m may be the Result of the Observation, and the tree is the FeatureOfInterest. A window is a FeatureOfInterest for an automatic window control Actuator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has site visit
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links, e.g., a [Site](#EcologicalSite) to a [Site Visit](#EcologicalSiteVisit).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: transect end point
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Refers to the [tern-loc:Point](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/loc/Point) representing the end of a transect.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CosmOz Station
rdf:Description.skos:definition: CosmOz is the Australian Cosmic-Ray Neutron Soil Moisture Monitoring Network Beginning in October 2010, CSIRO Land and Water installed cosmic-ray probes at a number of locations around Australia to form the inaugural CosmOz network. These sites were established at instrumented research sites operated by CSIRO and University collaborators to test and validate the operation of this new technology. These novel probes use cosmic rays originating from outer space to measure average soil moisture over an area of about 30 hectares to depths in the soil of between 10 to 50 cm. This constitutes a quantum leap over conventional on-ground soil moisture sensing technology that can only measure soil moisture content within small volumes of soil. Each system is comprised of a data logger, neutron detector, satellite telemetry, tipping bucket rain gauge, temperature humidity and pressure sensors and three surface moisture (TDR) probes. The system requires minimal maintenance and is powered by a solar charging system. The entire system is installed on a single mast. Data is logged and transmitted every 60 minutes to the CosmOz database.
rdf:Description.skos:editorialNote: Currently used by the platforms index for SHaRED.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fluxnet ID
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The unique identifier for flux towers registered with FLUXNET.
rdf:Description.skos:example: AU-ASM

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Method
rdf:Description.rdfs:scopeNote: We recommend representing the method information following [ISO 9001 Processes, Procedures and Work Instructions](https://3yn1j14c4twk1bmdg82226en-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/iso-9001-procedure.pdf)
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A Method describes in detailed steps how a workflow, protocol, plan or algorithm is carried out to make an [Observation](#Observation) or a [Sample](#Sample). It explains the steps to be carried out to arrive at reproducible [Result](#Result).
rdf:Description.skos:example: Borehole logging is a field method in which in situ physical measurements (e.g., temperature) are made down the length of a borehole by lowering measurement instruments down the borehole via cable. (Credit: PaST Thesaurus)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Site Visit
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A Site Visit is a discrete time-bounded activity at a [Site](#Site), during which [Sampling](#Sampling) or [Observation](#Observation) activities occur.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has observation theme
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link a concept to an observation theme.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ecological Site
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Location where observations may be made. This is a subclass of [Sample](#Sample) because a site should be designed to be representative of an environmental system (which may be an ecosystem or bioregion) or zone (which may be a zone such as a parcel or tract).
rdf:Description.skos:example: Ausplots Rangelands Site 59858 (Site Name: WAACOO0011)
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Use [dcterms:hasPart](http://purl.org/dc/terms/hasPart) and [dcterms:isPartOf](http://purl.org/dc/terms/isPartOf) to model [Site](#EcologicalSite) and [Subsite](#EcologicalSite) relationships. E.g. In TERN, there are SuperSites that contain multiple core 1 ha plots.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has method
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links a concept to a method.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Float
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Data type: Floating number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Text
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Class to encapsulate a textual value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has simple value
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The direct link to the value either as an IRI or an RDF literal. The simple value is always equivalent to the value captured in [rdf:value](http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#value) of the tern:Value instance.
rdf:Description.skos:example: An IRI, true, false, 1, "string", or a "string with language"@en, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sampling
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An activity of [Sampling](#Sampling) carries out a (Sampling) [Procedure](#Procedure) to create or transform one or more [Samples](#Sample).
rdf:Description.skos:example: Crushing a rock sample in a ball mill to create sub-samples of the rock. Digging a pit through a soil sequence. Dividing a field site into quadrants. Drawing blood from a patient. Drilling an observation well. Establishing a station for environmental monitoring. Registering an image of the landscape. Sieving a powder to separate the subset finer than 100-mesh. Selecting a subset of a population. Splitting a piece of drill-core to create two new samples. Taking a diamond-drill core from a rock outcrop.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: date commissioned
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The date when, e.g., a [Site](#EcologicalSite) is ready to commence its operations, after it is successfully installed and tested.
rdf:Description.skos:example: 1 August 2017 is the date commisioned of the [Collie flux station](http://ozflux.org.au/monitoringsites/collie/index.html)
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Use ISO 8601 international standard for representing dates and times. Missing start date may be set to the first of the month.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Platform
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An entity that hosts other entities, particularly [Sensors](#Sensor), [Samplers](#Sampler), and other [Platforms](#Platform).
rdf:Description.skos:example: Ocean buoy is an example of platform that is equipped with an array of sensors such as GPS, current meters, atmospheric sensors and water quality monitors. Sensors measuring weather variables are attached to a weather station (a platform)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: uncertainty
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Uncertainty for a quantitative value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ecosystem Processes Site
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An ecological [Site](#EcologicalSite) that usually hosts a [FluxTower](#FluxTower).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Value
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A value of an [Attribute](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Attribute) or an [Observation](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Observation).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: stratum
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A stratum is a distinct, easily seen, layer of foliage and branches of a measurable height.
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Value should be from a controlled vocabulary identified by a URI.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mobile Platform
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A moving mobile platform on land, in water or in space.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dimension
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Dimenion in metres.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is sub activity of
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links an activity to its parent activity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: location procedure
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link to a procedure used to obtain the location.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: unit
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The unit of measure of the value. Use [QUDT units of measure vocabulary](http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A link to a [tern:Value](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Value) which encapulates the value of this thing.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sample
rdf:Description.skos:definition: *A feature which is intended to be representative of a [FeatureOfInterest](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/FeatureOfInterest) on which [Observations](#Observation) may be made. Physical samples are sometimes known as physical specimens.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Plant, animal, soil and water are all examples of samples of some feature of interest.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Earth Observation Satellite
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Earth observation satellites are satellites specifically designed to observe Earth from orbit, similar to spy satellites but intended for non-military uses such as environmental monitoring, meteorology, map making etc. Source: Wikipedia, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth_observation_satellite Group: Platform_Details Entry_ID: Earth Observation Satellites Group: Platform_Identification Platform_Category: Earth Observation Satellites Short_Name: Earth Observation Satellites End_Group End_Group

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: method type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A particular method type used to conduct some survey.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: polygon
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The polygon of the subject.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Digital Camera
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The model as defined by the manufacturer.
rdf:Description.skos:example: E.g. EOS 350D

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Observable Property
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a [FeatureOfInterest](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/FeatureOfInterest). A feature-of-interest refers to a feature whose properties are measured or observed.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Sampling depth, bulk density, pH are examples of properties of a soil sample, and the soil sample is the feature-of-interest, representative of the area from which it is collected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Flux Tower
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Across the globe, towers stand among the landscape, with sensors monitoring these eddies for carbon dioxide, water vapor and other gasses. These so-called flux towers collect data on carbon dioxide exchange rates between the earth and atmosphere.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Alice Springs Mulga flux tower

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dataset
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations.
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: This class describes the actual dataset as published by the dataset provider. In cases where a distinction between the actual dataset and its entry in the catalog is necessary (because metadata such as modification date might differ), the catalog record class can be used for the latter.
This class describes the conceptual dataset. One or more representations might be available, with differing schematic layouts and formats or serializations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has site
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links, e.g., a [SiteVisit](#EcologicalSiteVisit) to a [Site](#EcologicalSite).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: taxon
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Taxon classification.
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Value should be from a controlled vocabulary identified by a URI.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: feature type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The feature type of a [Feature of Interest](#FeatureofInterest).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Parameter
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A [FeatureOfInterest's](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/FeatureOfInterest) property or characteristic which an [Observation](#Observation) is measuring using some [Procedure](#Procedure).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: centroid point
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The centroid point of an object-of-interest.
rdf:Description.skos:example: The geometric center of 1-ha vegetation plot expressed as [tern-loc:Point](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/loc/Point).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has attribute
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link to an [Attribute](#Attribute).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sample storage location
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links a [PhysicalSpecimen](#PhysicalSpecimen) to the location [Point](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/loc/Point) of where it is stored.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: value type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Relates a Property to a specialisation of tern:Value.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Use it to describe an instance of sosa:ObservableProperty and its recommended tern:Value type such as tern:QuantitativeMeasure, tern:Boolean, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sampler
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Sampler - A device that is used by, or implements, a (Sampling) [Procedure](#Procedure) to create or transform one or more samples.
rdf:Description.skos:example: A ball mill, diamond drill, hammer, hypodermic syringe and needle, image Sensor or a soil auger can all act as sampling devices (i.e., be Samplers). However, sometimes the distinction between the Sampler and the Sensor is not evident, as they are packaged as a unit. A Sampler need not be a physical device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has sampling point
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links, e.g., a [Sampling](#Sampling) to a [SamplingPoint](#SamplingPoint).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Attribute
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property-value pair. Same modelling pattern as [schema:PropertyValue](https://schema.org/PropertyValue).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Fixed Platform
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A fixed platform based on land.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Observation
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Act of carrying out an (Observation) [Procedure](#Procedure) to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a [FeatureOfInterest](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/FeatureOfInterest). Links to a [Sensor](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/Sensor) to describe what made the [Observation](#Observation) and how; links to an [ObservableProperty](#ObservableProperty) to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a [FeatureOfInterest](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/FeatureOfInterest) to detail what that property was associated with.
rdf:Description.skos:example: The activity of measuring properties such as wind speed and direction by an anemometer sensor. The results of the observation are the measurement values of the properties estimated by the sensor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: area
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The extent of a [Site](#EcologicalSite) area, e.g., in m2
rdf:Description.skos:example: The area of the Mitchell Grass Rangeland SuperSite Supersite is approximately 47 M (million) ha.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Distribution
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A specific representation of a dataset. A dataset might be available in multiple serializations that may differ in various ways, including natural language, media-type or format, schematic organization, temporal and spatial resolution, level of detail or profiles (which might specify any or all of the above).
rdf:Description.skos:example:
Examples of distributions include a CSV file, a [netCDF] file, a JSON document, or a data-cube, files made accessible according to different profiles, such as XML or JSON schemas or [ShEx] or [SHACL] expressions.
In some cases all distributions of a dataset will be fully informationally equivalent, in the sense that lossless transformations between the representations are possible. An example would be different serializations of an RDF graph using RDF/XML [RDF-SYNTAX-GRAMMAR], [Turtle], [N3], [JSON-LD]. However, in other cases the distributions might have different levels of fidelity to the underlying data. For example, a graphical representation about the data on a CSV file may not contain the same total information recorded in the CSV file, but they could be considered as two distributions for the same dataset as they are about the same data.
As a counter-example, budget data for different years would usually be modelled as different datasets, each with their own distributions, since all distributions of one dataset should broadly contain the same data.
Nevertheless, the question of whether different representations can be understood to be distributions of the same dataset, or distributions of different datasets, is application specific. Judgement about how to describe them is the responsibility of the provider, taking into account their understanding of the expectations of users, and practices in the relevant community.
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: This represents a general availability of a dataset. It implies no information about the actual access method of the data, i.e. whether by direct download, API, or through a Web page. The use of dcat:downloadURL property indicates directly downloadable distributions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: instrument type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The type of instrument used.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has parameter
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links a concept to a parameter.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sw point
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The south-west point of the subject.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: transect start point
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Refers to the [tern-loc:Point](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/loc/Point) representing the start of a transect.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dimension
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The dimension of a 2D square or rectangular feature. Example, the dimension of a rectangular plot [Site](#EcologicalSite). This class should perhaps have specialised classes to express not just square or rectangular features but also others such as circular features.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has categorical collection
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links a concept to a collection containing its categorical values.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: cardinal direction
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The cardinal direction of the *thing* represented as a string and expressed by cardinal and intercardinal points.
rdf:Description.skos:example: NNE, W, SE, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: purpose
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describe the purpose of something.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the material sample). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the materialSampleID globally unique.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: material sample ID
rdf:Description.skos:example: IGSN:ASR000001 (Resulting URI: http://igsn.org/ASR000001) is a globally unique and persistent identifier of a soil sample.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: domain
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The domain of the observation.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Vegetation, soil, disturbance, landform, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Feature which is managed for TERN purposes
transect direction
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describes the direction of the transect.
rdf:Description.skos:example: S-W

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vocabulary
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Controlled vocabulary, taxonomy etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is sampling point of
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The inverse property [hasSamplingPoint](#hasSamplingPoint).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Result
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The result of an [Observation](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Observation), [Actuation](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/Actuation), or act of [Sampling](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Sampling).
rdf:Description.skos:example: The value 20 as the height of a certain tree together with the unit, e.g., Meter.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: date decommissioned
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The date when, e.g., a [Site](#EcologicalSite) is decommissioned or stopped operating.
rdf:Description.skos:example: 30 Nov 2019 is the date decommisioned of the [Collie flux station](http://ozflux.org.au/monitoringsites/collie/index.html)
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Use ISO 8601 international standard for representing dates and times. Missing end date may be set to the end of the month.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: equipment
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describe the equipment used as text.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Procedure
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A workflow, protocol, plan, algorithm, or computational method specifying how to make an [Observation](#Observation), create a [Sample](#Sample), or make a change to the state of the world (via an [Actuator](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/Actuator). A [Procedure](#Procedure) is re-usable, and might be involved in many [Observations](#Observation), [Samplings](#Sampling), or [Actuations](http://w3.org/ns/sosa/Actuation). it explains the steps to be carried out to arrive at reproducible [Results](#Result).
rdf:Description.skos:example: The procedure for collecting photopoints are specified in the [AusPlots Rangelands Survey Protocols Manual](http://dx.doi.org/10.13140/2.1.4287.3607). The DEC Nature Conservation Service Biodiversity have defined [standard procedures](https://www.dpaw.wa.gov.au/images/documents/plants-animals/monitoring/sop/sop_establishingvegetationquadrats_20090818_v1.0.pdf) for establishing quadrats for vegetation sampling.
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: [Input](#Input) can be used to capture any input values for a procedure, such as the input value of the basal wedge to estimate the basal area per hectare.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: length
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A measure of distance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has sampling
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link to a [Sampling](#Sampling) instance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: scope
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describe the scope of something.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: observation type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The type of observation.
rdf:Description.skos:example: human observation, machine observation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is global match of
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An inverse property of [globalMatch](#globalMatch); Links an upper concept to a concept (in the closed system).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: width
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The measurement or extent of something from side to side.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Deployment
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describes the Deployment of one or more Systems for a particular purpose. Deployment may be done on a Platform.
rdf:Description.skos:example: For example, a temperature Sensor deployed on a wall, or a whole network of Sensors deployed for an Observation campaign.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sensor
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: global match
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link a concept to an upper concept (in the closed system).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has environmental characteristic
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The subject has some environmental characteristic. Points to a set of [Observations](#Observation) within an [EnvironmentalCharacteristic](#EnvironmentalCharacteristic).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: global value
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A property that links a concept from a vocabulary to another concept in an authoritative/endorsed vocabulary.
rdf:Description.skos:example: The concept dry soil colour is defined in two vocabularies, [CORVEG](http://linked.data.gov.au/def/corveg-cv/1842b772-72a4-430f-a264-dcfd6c2c23b4) and [Ausplots](http://linked.data.gov.au/def/ausplots-cv/aa11e5f7-aec2-4e92-95b8-6332911f0c4e). The property global value is used to map the concept from the two vocabularies to the relevant [concept](http://linked.data.gov.au/def/tern-cv/beceaa5a-a296-4385-a55a-3b8c8d5b2369) specified in the main vocabulary, i.e., TERN Vocabularies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Input
rdf:Description.skos:definition: *Input* - Any information that is provided to a [Procedure](#Procedure) for its use.
rdf:Description.skos:example: A **wedge prism** or **relascope** can be used to estimate the Basal Area per hectare. The number of counted trees and the Basal Area Factor are inputs to estimate the Basal Area.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: global vocabulary
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The global vocabulary refers to the main vocabulary, which takes precedence over other similar vocabularies to promote data harmonisation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Observation collection
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Collection of one or more observations, whose members share a common value for one or more property

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: location description
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The description of the location.
rdf:Description.skos:example: Location description of the AusPlots site NTABRT0004 in the Alice Mulga SuperSite: Pine Hill Station. 25km South East of Ti-Tree. 20km East of Stuart Highway. South west corner of the site is 200m north west of proposed supersite flux tower

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: site description
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Contextual information is collected at each site. This includes measures of slope an aspect, surface strew and lithology, and information on the grazing and fire history of the site (Credit: TERN AusPlots).
rdf:Description.skos:scopeNote: Value is usually a summary sentence of the site.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: soil horizon classifier
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Soil horizon classifier as defined in the Australian Soil and Land Survey Field Handbook on page 148.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has feature type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Links a concept to a feature type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has observation
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link to an [Observation](#Observation).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Integer
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Data type: Integer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Boolean
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Class to encapsulate a true-or-false value

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is attribute of
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link from an [Attribute](https://w3id.org/tern/ontologies/tern/Attribute) to some individual.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Taxon
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A group of organisms (sensu http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100026) considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit.
rdf:Description.skos:example: The genus Truncorotaloides as published by Bronnimann et al. in 1953 in the Journal of Paleontology Vol. 27(6) p. 817-820.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sampling type
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The type of sampling act.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Material sample
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A physical result of a sampling (or subsampling) event. In biological collections, the material sample is typically collected, and either preserved or destructively processed.
rdf:Description.skos:example: A whole organism preserved in a collection. A part of an organism isolated for some purpose. A soil sample. A marine microbial sample.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: instructions
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describe the instructions of the procedure/method.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has sub activity
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Link to an [Observation](#Observation) or [Sampling](#Sampling).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: soil classification
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The term used to classify the SoilProfile.
